<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. RME PM, Technology and Innovation

Location: Bellevue, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Product Management, Project Management

Description:
Description

The Regional Workplace Health & Safety (WHS) Manager, NA Reliability Maintenance Engineering (RME) will provide direct support and partnership to one or more of the North America Reliability & Maintenance Engineering regions. In addition to supporting an RME region from an execution standpoint, this role will also be responsible for engaging, collaborating and partnering with technical subject matter experts (SMEs) within WHS, RME, and other functions (e.g. Operations, Ops Construction, Ops Engineering, Worldwide Engineering, Research & Development, Suppliers, Amazon Robotics, procurement, etc.) to continually improve network WHS standards and procedures. The Regional WHS Manager, NA RME supports both the field in program execution but also is a technical program manager role responsible for managing RME related NA WHS programs (e.g. NA EHS procedures, processes, best practices, training, and network capital projects. The role also will own one or more of the RME safety processes, such as Technician Safety Concerns, Technician Safety Week and Marketing, RME Safety Network Actions (RSNA), RME Technical Safety Teams, Metrics, Fall Hazard Engineering program, RME Safety Training, etc.

Key job responsibilities

Lastly, this role must have demonstrated skills in: Partnering with stakeholders to drive Safety Ownership, customer obsession, excel at WHS regulatory research, data analytics, and document technical writing.

A day in the life

Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:

 Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) Plan

If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

About The Team

Regional WHS Manager, RME Responsibilities:

 Develop a deep working relationship and partnership with RME and WHS stakeholders for the region(s) that you directly support. Establish Incident Investigation, escalation and reporting structures within your area of responsibility to ensure timely notification and collaboration on root cause analysis and controls are delivered. Ensure Technician Safety Concerns are promptly addressed or escalated to applicable stakeholder’s/support teams at the site, regional or network level. Ensure RME Safety Network Actions (RSNA) are effectively communicated, sites have the ability to ask questions to gain further clarification, and establish methods for tracking completion. Review incidents to determine which require WHS Alerts or RME Safety Network Actions and drive the site RME and EHS teams to develop content through the WHS Communications process. Partner with equipment OEMs, Ops Engineering, WWE, RME, EHS Engineering, etc. on equipment related incidents where design or retrofits may be necessary across multiple business units. Become a SME in Amazon’s Contract Risk Management (CRM) program, and ensure site RME teams are executing on contractor induction by engaging with site teams and with third party service providers in your region(s) to ensure compliance with regulatory and amazon WHS policy, assist with incident investigations, and assist in clarifying Amazon policy. Partner with all stakeholders to continuously improve NA EHS Program requirements (programs, standards, training, etc.) related to RME. Support the RME Leadership in improving our Technicians engagement and involvement in order to have strong ownership, bias for action in escalating safety issues, task creep, stop work authority, and peer review related safety programs. Use Safety Leadership Index (SLI) results to deep dive into Technician culture and engagement as it relates to safety to identify gaps and partner with RME leadership to drive actions to improve the overall safety culture. Maintain and utilize the RME Portal for safety related communications. Support the WHS governance and compliance organizations to evaluate regulatory misses for network corrective action related to RME. Stay attuned to changing regulations and internal EHS performance to change policies when required.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Bellevue, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 5+ years of program or project management experience Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership Bachelor's Degree in Safety, Engineering, or related field Must possess a minimum of 5+ years' work experience in Safety, Engineering, Reliability, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications

 5+ years of driving process improvements experience Masters Degree in Safety, Safety Engineering, Engineering, or related field Associate Safety Professional (ASP) or Certified Safety Professional (CSP)

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $92,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2584534

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
